Description: Olive wood mummy-label of Senpsais the Elder, daughter of Peteube(s)tis (?). 5 lines of Greek on one side, 5 lines of Demotic on the other.
Curator's comments: Since mummified bodies were sometimes temporarily stored awaiting their turn to be buried, inscribed wooden labels were attached to the corpses for identification. The different ages listed on either side are not a mistake, but may be due to a turn of phrase in expressing ages in demotic. Namely that the phrase used can be translated as 'in their X year'; where being in the first year of life is counted from birth to age 1. So the deceased was 15 in the Greek language, but in her 16th year in demotic. For more on this see Arlt 2011, 114-16. Published in: Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, p. 167
Bibliographic references: Arlt 2011 / Deine Seele möge leben für immer und ewig: Die demotischen Mumienschilder im British Museum (no.121)
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
